thread.title: Sedgefield constituency General Election results 2017: Full standings, MP and reaction

author: Mike Kelly
title: Sedgefield constituency General Election results 2017: Full standings, MP and reaction

persons.name: phil wilson phil wilson  phil wilson

text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This page provides full information about the Sedgefield constituency including candidates standing in the General Election 2017 , history of the seat and 2015 results. 
The interactive tool and information will be updated to show General Election 2017 results once the vote count is declared. 
The polls close at 10pm on Thursday, June 8 and results start being declared around midnight, with Sunderland and Newcastle usually among the first constituencies in the country to announce. 
This page will be updated as soon as the constituency in question has declared. Read More What are the results in my constituency? 
Enter your postcode below to find out more details on your constituency. Which parties and candidates standing in Sedgefield? 
Conservative - Dehenna Davison Dehenna Davison 
Dehenna is committed to supporting the Prime Minister through the Brexit negotiations and beyond to deliver the right deal for Sedgefield. 
Her other political interests include transport, digital communications, and culture. 
Dehenna works for a North East company, as well as studying for a Postgraduate Degree. In her spare time, she enjoys watching football, video gaming and running. She also loves to cook and bake. 
Labour - Phil Wilson Phil Wilson 
Phil Wilson has lived in Sedgefield all of his life and is the son of a Fishburn miner. 
Known as one of the ‘Famous Five’ local Labour Party members who helped the young Tony Blair secure candidacy for Sedgefield. He started his career as a shop worker and when he joined the civil service as a clerical worker became a trade union official. 
He has also worked as a gambling lobbyist. 
He has previously said bringing a Hitachi Rail factory project to Newton Aycliffe in his constituency represents was one of his proudest political achievements. 
Lib Dem - Stephen Psallidas 
Stephen was born in South Tyneside. 
He currently lives in Newcastle and works in engineering project management in the city. 
Stephen was also a councillor in the city’s Ouseburn Ward for 14 years until 2016, and helped to deliver a variety of community projects in the ward, to residents’ benefit. He enjoys cycling, cinema and travel in his spare time. 
Green - Melissa Wilson Melissa Wilson 
Lives on the outskirts of Darlington, in the Sedgefield constituency, where she has been involved with the local community for over 18 years. Melissa has four children who attend schools within Newton Aycliffe. 
She joined the Green party in 2014 after trying to find a party that fit my socialist as well as environmental beliefs. She’s a founding member of 999 Call for the NHS and 999 Call for Education and has campaigned extensively on these matters particularly in my local area. 
UKIP - John Grant John Grant 
John was born and bred in Newton Aycliffe and has lived there for over 35 years. 
He currently serves as branch chairman of UKIP Sedgefield and her’s also on the committee for Aycliffe Village Hall. 
John says he will pursue all areas of concern in the residents interests irrespective of UKIP party policies. 
He will look out for matters concerning social care in the community for the elderly and vulnerable. What was the result in Sedgefield in 2015? 
Phil Wilson (Lab): 18,275 (47.2) 
Scott Wood (Con): 11,432 (29.5%) 
John Leathley (UKIP): 6,426 (16.6%) 
Stephen Glenn (Lib Dem): 1,370 (3.5%) 
Greg Robinson (Green): 1,213 (3.1%) 
Turnout 61.6% 
Winner: Phil Wilson (majority 6,843) Read More
